name: treatment of waste plastic, consumer electronics, dismantling, sorting and cleaning, formal sector | waste plastic, consumer electronics, sorted | Cutoff, U
description:
ecoQuery: https://ecoquery.ecoinvent.org/3.10/cutoff/dataset/21672/documentation

The formal plastic recycling sector in India contributes to a comparitively smaller percentage of the overall plastic recycling of the country in comparison with the informal sector. The formal plastic recycling sector depends on its supply chain for raw material. The formal sector has its systems in place to segregate, dismantle, sort and clean the waste plastics received. The formal sector ensures safe segregation and dismantling techniques in its functioning. Visited formal recyclers were from different parts of the country based out of Pune, Bangalore, Hyderabad. Electricity is obtained from the grid. Data collection questionnaire was circulated amongst the recyclers and on-site visits were carried out. Information provided was verified and actual readings were taken related to electrical energy consumption the formal sector. The dataset is representation of treatment of plastic wastes.

This dataset include activities that occur once the material is received by the formal sector for further processing.

This dataset includes activities until the received waste plastics is segregated, dismantled and sorted.
category: E:Water supply; sewerage, waste management and remediation activities/38:Waste collection, treatment and disposal activities; materials recovery/383:Materials recovery/3830:Materials recovery

processDocumentation.timeDescription: The recycling sector has been following this method for several years. There is no anticipated change in the next few years in their method of working. However, with the new e-waste rules in the country, bringing in more focus on sustainable recycling, certain changes are expected to occur over a period of time.
processDocumentation.geographyDescription: The geography included for the formal sector includes the leading formal plastic recyclers spread across the country.
processDocumentation.technologyDescription: The technology that is used in the formal sector is standard and is uniformly adopted by all the formal recyclers. The equipment is maintained and is not of very old technology.
processDocumentation.dataTreatmentDescription: The geography included for the formal sector is a wide representation of formal recyclers spread across the country.
processDocumentation.samplingDescription: An initial data collection questionnaire was circulated amongst the recyclers. On-site visits were carried out and data was collected from leading recyclers in the formal recycling sector. Information provided was verified and readings were taken for information that is unavailable with the formal sector. The recyclers were engaged into recycling of plastics mainly Polycarbonate (PC), High Impact Polystyrene (HIPS), Acrylonitrile Butadiene Styrene (ABS), Poly Propylene (PP) etc.Data collected from different recyclers was compiled in the excel sheets and analysed. All the data was aggregated to per 1000 kgs of treatment of waste plastics.

exchanges.description: This exchange represents the cleaned and sorted material used by formal and informal plastic recycling sectors in India. These recyclers are engaged into recycling of different plastic types from e-waste/WEEE, mainly Polycarbonate (PC), High Impact Polystyrene (HIPS), Acrylonitrile Butadiene Styrene (ABS), Poly Propylene (PP) etc.
Addition of COD to Common ETP
Addition of BOD to common ETP. BOD is not measured thus BOD is assumed to be 0.3 times of COD
Addition of Nitrogen to common ETP
Addition of TOC to common etp

This exchange represents the material input of the formal and informal plastic recycling sectors in India. These recyclers are engaged into recycling of different plastic types from e-waste/WEEE, mainly Polycarbonate (PC), High Impact Polystyrene (HIPS), Acrylonitrile Butadiene Styrene (ABS), Poly Propylene (PP) etc.
